main event: A series of UFO sightings were reported in Dayton, Ohio during May 1956, including observations of unknown objects with various descriptions.
interesting points: One sighting on May 22, 1956, was initially thought to be a balloon but was later confirmed to be from the Sulphur Grove weather station., A witness described an object with bluish strobe lamps that lasted 8-9 seconds in the sky., Another sighting involved an object that made a whirring sound and moved rapidly, described as about 100 feet in diameter., One report noted an object with a solid appearance, compared to the size of a dime, approximately 10 feet long., A local high school student contributed to the observation categorization and analysis of sightings.
witness description: No specific witnesses detailed are confirmed in the report.
